TopicTitle: No brakes on your bubble wheels

Articles.Content:
The brakes on The RoveMax Model M1 DO NOT WORK!

MYCRAFTisbest: I think they changed the number properly in 0.9 and then accidentally used the original code for the brake torque with the number unphased.

I'm just a squeaky wheel trying to help

Peace and kindness.
I am suing for the unauthorized use of my twitch comment. (It's ok by me)
This is a non issue for now, the wheels have been confirmed to have an overhaul in 1.1 so it's possible this is fixed already.
In the mean time, use the Stock Bug Fix Modules which make it so brakes work properly on rover wheels.

1.1 is still "In the distant future, in the galaxy far FAR away".

Last I heard:

They have an internal date for 1.1 but no public date.

QA should start up next week, "if everything goes right."

Q: 1.1 before Christmas?

A: It's not that far away.

QA usually takes 1-2 months, so end of November at the latest.

1.1 is still "In the distant future, in the galaxy far FAR away".

Especially for mod users, they will wait another year or two, until all their mods are updated or replaced.

That is irrelevant. This request, if implemented, would be in 1.1. They aren't going to have a 1.0.5 for wheels when they had to recode them for 1.1 anyway. All I'm saying is this request may be moot at this stage. I said "may", I don't know for certain but the way Harvester talks, the wheels are supposedly much more realistic in the coming version.
